text: The 1969 UCI Track Cycling World Championships were the World Championship for track cycling. The events of the men's sprint and the individual pursuit for professionals were held in Antwerp, Belgium the other events took place in Brno, Czechoslovakia.World Championship Track Cycling 2014-1893 Eleven events were contested, 9 for men (3 for professionals, 6 for amateurs) and 2 for women between 5 and 9 August 1969. ==Medal summary== {| |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Professional Events |- |Men's sprint | Patrick Sercu || Robert Van Lancker || Sante Gaiardoni |- | | Ferdinand Bracke || Hugh Porter || Peter Post |- |Men's motor-paced | Jacob Oudkerk || Theo Verschueren || Domenico De Lillo |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Amateur Events |- | |Gianni Sartori || Janusz Kierzkowski || Klaas Balk |- |Men's sprint | Daniel Morelon || Omar Phakadze || Peder Pedersen |- | | Xaver Kurmann || Bernard Darmet || Daniel Rebillard |- |Men's team pursuit | Stanislav Moskvin Vladimir Kuznetzov Viktor Bykov Sergeï Kuskov || Pietro Algeri Giacomo Bazzan Giorgio Morbiato Antonio Castello || Claude Buchon Bernard Darmet René Grignon Daniel Rebillard |- |Men's motor-paced |Bert Boom || Cees Stam || Jörg Peter |- |Men's tandem | Hans-Jürgen Geschke Werner Otto || Jürgen Barth Rainer Muller || Pierre Trentin Daniel Morelon |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Women's Events |- |Women's sprint |Galina Tsareva |Galina Ermolaeva |Irina Kiritchenko |- |Women's individual pursuit |Raisa Obodovskaya |Tamara Garkuchina |Keetie Hage |} ==Medal table== ==See also== * 1969 UCI Road World Championships ==References== Track cycling Track cycling Category:UCI Track Cycling World Championships by year Category:International cycle races hosted by Belgium Category:International cycle races hosted by Czechoslovakia Category:1969 in track cycling
title: 1969 UCI Track Cycling World Championships
